proposalPage.author: Author
proposalPage.beforeActivationWarning1:
Proposals can't be edited once actived. The proposal fee is non-refundable.
 Make sure it's accurate and up-to-date before you continue.
proposalPage.beforeActivationWarning2: Review your budget in case the price of EOS has changed since you created your draft.
proposalPage.sureToActivate: Are you sure you want to activate your proposal for the current voting period?
proposalPage.currentVotingPeriodEndsIn: The current voting period ends in {daysTillEnd} day(s)
proposalPage.payFeeDesc: You must pay a 100 EOS proposal fee before you can activate your proposal.
proposalPage.activateDesc: Note, clicking this button pushes the proposal onchain. This action is irreversible.
proposalPage.refundDesc: You can get your proposal fee back if you don't want to publish your proposal. This action is only possible if you haven't activated the proposal.
proposalPage.editDesc: You can edit a proposal that hasn't been activated yet.
proposalPage.deleteDesc: This action removes a proposal from drafts and you won't be able to access it again.

about.overviewP1: The EOS Worker Proposal System (WPS) is a funding mechanism for the EOS Mainnet, enabling developers and other value creators to seek funding from the EOS blockchain for their projects outside of EOS block rewards. It’s modeled closely after the {dashNexus} which has been successfully funding projects benefiting the DASH ecosystem. It also pulls from our experience designing and maintaining the BOS Ecosystem Program. We’ve analyzed real node, developer, and token holder behaviour in both these systems over an extended period of time in order to design an improved version for the EOS Mainnet.
about.overviewP2: This decentralized voting & distribution mechanism is governed by the rules coded within the WPS smart contracts, which allows any EOS account to propose a budget for their specific project and Block Producers elected by token holders to vote on them. Each proposal that passes is paid directly from the {eosio} account to the EOS account that proposed the work.
about.votingPeriodsAndFundingP1: A maximum budget of {maxMonthlyBudget} will be made available for each {votingPeriod}. The period budget and duration are settings within the WPS smart contract that can be adjusted by MSIG approval from 15 of the top 21 Block Producers.
about.votingPeriodsAndFundingP2: {eosio} is funded from the fees accumulated in the eosio.names and eosio.ramfee accounts prior to the deployment of REX. Prior to REX, these accounts accumulated roughly 3.5 million EOS from EOS premium name auctions and RAM purchase fees. These administrative fees were voluntarily collected from token holders by the network. It’s important to note these funds do not stem from inflation or taxation as they originate from services rendered by the network for specific individuals at their request. An MSIG approval from 15 of the top 21 Block Producers will be required to move funds to eosio.wps, and this will occur on an ongoing basis.
about.votingPeriodsAndFundingP3: Any ongoing fees being collected by `eosio.names` & `eosio.ramfee` will continue to flow to REX holders and shall not be transferred to `eosio.wps`. Funds flowing into REX will not be affected by this proposal.
about.votingPeriodsAndFundingP4: We’ll propose to transfer 50,000 EOS, or two periods worth, to the `eosio.wps` account upon activation of the EOS WPS system. We’ll propose a top-up of another {maxMonthlyBudget} one month ahead of each period. This gives the top 21 the flexibility to discontinue the WPS system at any time by simply not funding it.
about.passingProposalsP: To pass a proposal, it must meet the following {proposalThreshold} at the close of the voting period
about.proposalThresholdP1: A minimum of {voteMargin} net positive votes are required from eligible voters.
about.proposalThresholdP2: The cumulative budget of all passing proposals cannot exceed the allocated period budget of {maxMonthlyBudget}.
about.proposalThresholdP3: a) If the cumulative budget of proposals that meet the voting threshold exceeds the allocated period budget, proposals will be awarded their requested budgets in order of voting rank only until the maximum budget is met.
about.eligibleVoterP1: Any Block Producer who meets the 100-EOS-per-day vote pay reward threshold on the EOS Mainnet within the last 24 hours is considered an {eligibleVoter}. All eligible voters have an equal vote weight and can cast a plus 1 (+1),  minus 1 (-1), or abstain (0) vote for each proposal.
about.eligibleVoterP2: The proposal threshold, eligible voter requirements, and vote weights are all settings within the WPS smart contract that can be adjusted with an MSIG approval from 15 of the top 21 Block producers.
about.requirementsP: Any account on the EOS Mainnet can submit a draft proposal. To limit spam, a non-refundable fee of {depositFee} must be paid to eosio.wps to publish a proposal.
about.eligibleVoterThreshold: BPs who have met 100 EOS/day reward threshold for a minimum of 24 hours at the close of each period
about.voteWeightP: All eligible BPs have an equal vote weight and can cast a plus 1 (+1),  minus 1 (-1), or abstain (0) vote for each proposal
about.fundSourceP: Legacy (pre-REX) eosio.names and eosio.ramfee accumulated administrative fees

1.question: Who can request funds through the EOS Worker Proposal System?
1.answer: Anyone with an EOS account who pays the {depositFee} proposal fee.

2.question: Who can participate in voting on EOS WPS proposals?
2.answer: Block Producers on the EOS Public Network who have met the 100 EOS/day reward threshold for at least 24 hours.

3.question: Why is there a {depositFee} fee to submit a proposal?
3.answer: To limit spam so that Block Producers can focus on reviewing only serious proposals.

4.question: Where does the {depositFee} fee go?
4.answer: The fee goes into the eosio.wps account to be redistributed to passing proposals.

5.question: Is the {depositFee} fee ever refunded?
5.answer: No, the fee is non-refundable once the proposal has been published. However, during the draft period of a proposal, the deposit of {depositFee} can be refunded.

6.question: Can my proposal be eligible for the next period if it does not meet the threshold in during the voting period it was published?
6.answer: No, if your proposal doesn’t pass in the period it was published, it is closed and not eligible for voting in the next period. If you’re publishing a proposal near the end of a period, consider waiting to publish it until the start of the next period.

7.question: When will funds for passed proposals be transferred to the proposer?
7.answer: On closing of the voting period, EOS will be automatically transferred to proposers whose proposals have passed.

8.question: Can I request to be paid in Fiat or something other than EOS?
8.answer: No, budgets will only be paid in EOS.

9.question: Can I request payment in milestones, or does it need to be a lump sum?
9.answer: Yes, you can request to split your payment across a maximum of 6 {days}-day periods, coinciding with the voting periods. But payment is subject to continued voting for each period. Votes for multi-period proposals roll over to subsequent voting periods. Payment will only be transferred during periods where the proposal meets the proposal threshold. If threshold is not met during a period, the proposal will remain active for the next voting periods.

10.question: Do I need to pay a fee for each voting period for my multi-period proposal?
10.answer: No, the {depositFee} fee paid to publish the proposal covers you for up to 6 periods.

11.question: Can I adjust my proposal after it has been published?
11.answer: No, a proposal can’t be changed after it’s been published.

12.question: What if the EOS price changes drastically? Can I edit my budget in that case?
12.answer: No, a proposal can’t be changed after it’s been published.

13.question: How much work can be expected to get a proposal funded?
13.answer: Data from other WPS shows that a lot of work is required to get a proposal funded. It is up to the proposer to seek and obtain votes on the proposal. The network does not provide guidance, nor guarantee, as to how to get funded.

userGuide.selectDate: Select a date in the popup calendar.

signInSection.title: Sign in to EOS WPS Portal

li2.title: Sign in with your EOS account
li2.b: Select your preffered wallet and sign in with the account you'd like to use to submit the proposal.

signInSection.li3: Click the “Create proposal” button at the top of the portal

setupProposalSection.title: Setup Proposal
setupProposalSection.containMin: It must contain a minimum of {num} characters
setupProposalSection.containMax: It can contain a maximum of {num} characters

subSection1.title: Enter all of the required fields:

li1.title: {proposalName} serves as a unique identifier for your proposal. It won’t be displayed anywhere in the portal, but will be added as a record in the table in the WPS smart contract.
li1.subLi4: It must only contain lower-case english characters or numbers 1-5

li2.title: {proposalTitle} will display to voters in the portal as the title of your proposal in the the list of active proposals and on the details page of your proposal.

li3.title: {proposalSummary} is a short summary of your proposal that will be displayed to voters in the portal with your proposal in the list of active proposals and on the details page of your proposal.

li4.title: {proposalCategory} helps organize proposals according to the type of work being proposed. It will be displayed to voters in the portal with your proposal in the list of active proposals and on the details page of your proposal.
li4.a: Select the appropriate category from the options provided in the drop-down:

li5.title: {proposalBudget} is the amount of EOS that will be transferred to your account if your proposal passes. You can request a single payment, or up to 6 monthly payments. You can break your budget down into multiple line items to display a detailed tally of costs, or simply add one budget item containing the full cost (see sample of detailed budget below). The total budget will be displayed to voters in the portal with your proposal in the list of active proposals and the full tally will be displayed along with the total on the details page of your proposal.
li5.a: Click the “Add new item” button under the “Add budget items to your proposal” heading near the bottom of the page.
li5.b: Enter a {title} for your budget line item.
li5.c: Enter the {cost} (in EOS) for your budget line item.

d.title: Enter the {amount} of those items included in your budget.
d.subLi1: The {subtotal} for the budget line item will reflect the {cost} multiplied by the {amount}.

li5.e: Select the unit type from the options provided in the drop-down:
li5.g: Repeat steps a-f if you have additional budget line items to add.

h.title: Select the {durationOfPayments} from the options provided in the dropdown.
h.subLi1: Payments can be divided equally between 1-6 months
h.subLi2: The total budget will be divided by the duration of payments to determine the monthly EOS budget.

subSection2.title: Enter the optional fields, if you wish:

li1.title: {heroImage} is an optional image you can include to help illustrate or bring attention to your proposal. It will be displayed to voters in the portal with your proposal in the list of active proposals and on the details page of your proposal.
li1.a: Enter the URL of the image you’d like to include with your proposal.
li1.subLi1: Note: it is up to you to upload the image to whichever image sharing or web hosting service you choose.

li2.title: {videoLink} is an optional link to a video you can include to help explain your proposal. It will be displayed to voters in the portal on the details page of your proposal.
li2.a: Enter the URL of the video you’d like to include with your proposal.
li2.subLi1: Note: it is up to you to upload the video to whichever video sharing or web hosting service you choose.

subSection3.title: Save your draft and continue to the next step:

li1.title: If you’d like to save your progress before moving on to the next step, click the “Save Draft” button at the bottom of the page.
li1.a: Click the “Allow” button in the scatter pop-up to save your progress to the blockchain.

li2.title: Click the “Continue” button at the bottom of the page to move on to the next step.
li2.subLi1: Note: progress won’t be saved unless you click the “Save Draft” button. Progress will be lost if you don’t save your draft on the next step or complete the proposal submission process.

descriptionSection.title: Provide a detailed description for your proposal
descriptionSection.li1: Enter a detailed {description} in the free-form text field provided. Feel free to use the formatting options made available to help make your description stand out. The description will be displayed to voters in the portal on the details page of your proposal.
descriptionSection.li2: Click the “Save Draft” button at the bottom of the page to save your progress to the blockchain.
descriptionSection.li3: Click the “Continue” button at the bottom of the page to move on to the next step.

li1.title: Add a {timeline} for a project milestone to inform voters of when you plan to deliver specific milestones of your proposal. It will be displayed to them in the details page of your proposal.
li1.f: Repeat steps a-e if you have additional milestones to add.

publishProposalSection.title: Publish proposal
publishProposalSection.preface: Now that your draft is saved, you should be on the Drafts page of the EOS WPS portal. You can access this page at any time by clicking the Drafts button at the top of the portal. Here you can see a list of all of the draft proposals currently awaiting to be published, including the draft you just saved. Click on your proposal to go to the details page. From here you can review your proposal and have options to pay the proposal fee, edit the proposal, or delete the proposal. Before you can publish your proposal, you must pay the proposal fee.

subSection1.title: Pay proposal fee:
subSection1.li2: Approve the transfer of {depositFee} to the eosio.wps account by clicking the “Allow” button in the Scatter pop-up window.
subSection1.p1: Once the fee has been successfully paid, you’ll see new options to activate the proposal or refund your proposal fee. Once you activate the proposal you are no longer able to edit the proposal or refund your proposal fee. Make sure you’re happy with the proposal before moving on to the final step.

subSection2.title: Activate proposal:
subSection2.li2: Read the disclaimer in the pop-up window. Your proposal can’t be edited once it’s activated.

li3.title: Decide if you want to activate the proposal immediately or for the next voting period. The pop-up window will display how many days remain in the voting period. Your proposal needs to pass in the voting period it’s published - so consider activating for the next voting period if the current period is nearing the end. Voting periods are {days} days.

a.title: Click “Activate for current” if you want to activate your proposal for the current period.
a.subLi1: If there are 5 days or less remaining in the voting period, you’ll be prevented from activating the proposal for the current period.

li3.b: Click “Activate for next” if you want to activate your proposal for the next period.

subSection2.li4: Click “Allow” in the Scatter pop-up to activate your proposal.
subSection2.p1: If you clicked the “Activate for current” option, your proposal should now be displayed in the Active proposals section of the EOS WPS Portal and is available for voting by EOS Block Producers. If you clicked “Activate for next,” it will begin displaying there as soon as the next voting period begins.

validationMessages.minLength: The field must be at least {numberOfChars} characters long
validationMessages.maxLength: The field must be at most {numberOfChars} characters long
validationMessages.proposalNameRegex: A proposal can have lower case english characters or numbers 1-5 only
validationMessages.latinNoSpecialsRegex: Only english characters are allowed, special characters are not allowed
validationMessages.onlyNumbersDecimals: Only numbers and decimals are allowed
validationMessages.minValue: The value must be at least {value}
validationMessages.maxValue: The value must be at most {value}
validationMessages.urlString: The field must be a URL

notifications.durationErr: Duration must be at least 1 month and at most 6 months
notifications.budgetErr: Monthly budget must be at least 100 EOS
notifications.budgetErrMax: Monthly budget cannot be greater than {maxMonthlyBudget}
notifications.milestonesEmpty: Add at least one timeline item
notifications.proposalNameExists: A proposal with the same name already exists! Try another one.
notifications.scatterIsNotConnected: Scatter is not connected. Please install/open Scatter plugin or desktop application and refresh this page.
notifications.tooManyItems: Too many items. The number cannot be more than 15
notifications.mustFinishTheStep: You must finish the current step
notifications.smallName: Should be at least 3 characters in length
notifications.largeTitle: Title should be less than 1024 characters long
notifications.smallTitle: Title should be at least 3 characters long
notifications.smallDuration: Duration must be a minimum of 1 monthly period
notifications.largeDuration: Duration must not exceed 6 monthly periods
notifications.votingPeriodMustBeInPast: Voting period must be in the past
notifications.smallVotingPeriod: Voting interval must be equal or above 24 hours
notifications.voterMustBeProducer: Voter must be registered as a producer
notifications.voterMustHaveClaimedProducerRewards: Voter must have claimed producer rewards
notifications.proposalNameHasNotYetStarted: Proposal name has not yet started
notifications.tooMushProposals: Cannot exceed 100 proposals per single voting period
notifications.votingPeriodNotEqualTo: Voting period must be equal to current or next
notifications.accountHasntAmountToRefund: Account has no amount to refund
notifications.accountHasntBalance: Account does not contain a balance
notifications.smallBalance: Post balance cannot be less than 0
notifications.cannotActivateWithin: Cannot be activated shortly after the end of the next voting period
notifications.notEligibleCommentator: Only eligible proposers are allowed to comment

comments.sureToDeleteComment: Are you sure you want to delete the comment?
